item.title: How Facebook Reactions Will Change Publishing
item.description:
How Facebook Reactions Will Change Publishing

The debut of Reactions last week was heralded with a pair of blog posts to hype its release. The first, written by product manager Sammi Krug, lauded the update as a bold new step for Facebook after years of building the Like buttonâ€™s value. The other, posted by Facebook product design director Geoff Teehan, detailed the work that went into developing the new system and its five new choices: Love, Haha, Wow, Angry and Sad. Together, these posts illustrate two major points:

item.title: The Grid
item.description:
The Grid

A digital frontier. I tried to picture clusters of information as they moved through the computer. What did they look like? Ships? motorcycles? Were the circuits like freeways? I kept dreaming of a world I thought I'd never see. And then, one day...I got in.
